attributes.action: Don't reintroduce the bee-killing pesticide Neonicotinoid Thiamethoxam!
attributes.additional_details:
This pesticide kills bees and bees are already dwindling in numbers as it is.

I see that the UK actually signed an agreement to use this pesticide as an emergency use pesticide, but this shouldn't happen!

This KILLS BEES! In no way should this product be allowed to be used as a pesticide!!
There is no reason it should be allowed, especially as there are still many other products available!
attributes.background:
Now the UK has left the EU, can the government keep banned Neonicotinoid Thiamethoxam pesticides which kills bees?
I see you have allowed emergency use of this bee killer which shouldn't be allowed!

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Overturn the decision to allow the use of neonicotinoid pesticides
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/569214

Continue the ban on the use of Neonicotinoids
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/563943
